reviews.title: Authentic Mexican in Maastricht
reviews.text:
In a busy street of Maastricht is this low-key eatery with authentic Mexican food. Don’t be put off by the somewhat basic decoration, it looks a bit like a canteen along the highway. But the food is really delicious! We had the tacos with chicken and quesadillas with mexican chorizo. Good taste and very tasty. The drinks (cans of cola and fanta) we found expensive. Super nice service and it was a coming and going of people. Highly recommended! 
Why not 5 stars? We arrived at 5.30pm and by then some dishes were already sold out. And the bathroom... let's just say it could use a revamp. So therefore 4 stars.

articleContent.title: Your go-to guide for dog-friendly travel

seoInfo.metaDescription: Traveling with your dog has never been easier—or more fun. Cities across the country boast pet-friendly hotels, parks, and activities. With CESAR® brand’s mission to make the world more pet-friendly and Tripadvisor’s top-rated spots, you can plan with confidence. Whether it’s a quick getaway or a bucket-list trip, our guides help you stay, play, and explore with your pup. Grab the leash and go!

articleContent.title: Why Greenville, SC is the perfect mix of adventure and luxury

seoInfo.metaDescription: There are few places that blend luxury and outdoor adventure like Greenville, South Carolina. The days (and mild weather) are made for adrenaline rushes of all types, while the region’s spas, fine dining, and boutique properties serve up luxury experiences that last well into the evening. It’s not hard to dive into a handful of the many treats on offer, and crafting an itinerary that incorporates a little bit of everything is how you’ll find yourself with a Greenville-shaped spot forever in your heart.

I’ve always loved train travel. There’s something special about settling into a window seat and watching the landscape drift past. And as a wheelchair user, that joy only grows when the journey feels easy: level boarding, space to move, and the kind of accessibility that lets you fully relax. For me, the best train rides—like weaving through the Tuscan countryside on Trenitalia—are never just a way to get from A to B; they're part of the adventure.

articleContent.title: Can you drink tap water in Paris? Tips and tricks to staying hydrated

seoInfo.metaDescription: Yes, Paris tap water is perfectly safe to drink! Read on for tips on how to order tap water at restaurants, finding drinkable water fountains, and more.
